parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Food, nourishment, maintenance. From trepho; nourishment; by implication, rations.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To invigorate, strengthen. From en and ischuo; to invigorate.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Damascus. Of Hebrew origin; Damascus, a city of Syria.
